CHAPTER 1337
Drainage and Grade Establishment
1337.01   Definitions.
1337.02   Established elevation to be finished grade.
1337.03   Drainage of surface water.
1337.04   Positive drainage to be provided; nuisances abated.
1337.05   Required plot plan information.
1337.06   Drainage inspection permit fees.
1337.07   Prior approval of grading plans.
1337.08   Approval upon completion of grading.
1337.09   Engineer to fix all finished grade lines.
1337.10   Administration and enforcement.
1337.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Notice to fill or drain lots - see GEN. OFF.
521.05
Obstructing natural watercourses - see S.U. & P.S.
919.01
Topsoil stripping and removal - see BLDG. Ch.
1339
 
 
1337.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this Chapter the following terms shall have the meaning
given herein:
   (a)   "Natural grade" shall mean the elevation of the undisturbed natural
surface of the ground.
   (b)   "Finished grade" shall mean the elevation of the finished surface.
      (Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.02 ESTABLISHED ELEVATION TO BE FINISHED GRADE.
   When a lot or plot is graded, the established elevations of the street,
curb, sidewalk or alley (whichever prevails) shall become the finished grade at
that line.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.03 DRAINAGE OF SURFACE WATER.
   (a)   Whenever the surface of a lot or plot, or portion thereof, is
excavated, filled, graded or hard-surfaced with impervious material, positive
drainage shall be provided so that a nuisance will not be created.
   (b)    Catch basins properly connected to storm sewers or other approved
provisions, such as underdrains, shall be made where water may pocket to
preclude the accumulation of surface water.
   (c)   Existing natural ground drainage of the ground area surrounding the
lot or plot excavated, filled or graded shall not be impeded.
   (d)   Surface water shall not be drained onto adjacent properties not in the
same ownership without written permission from the owner of the adjacent
property.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.04 POSITIVE DRAINAGE TO BE PROVIDED; NUISANCES ABATED.
   No condition shall be created nor any existing condition maintained whereby
there will be upon any lot or plot excavations, depressions, pits, holes,
gullies or similar depressions which may accumulate and retain surface water
and which may become a public hazard or nuisance. Any such condition shall be
properly abated and protected by filling or by providing positive drainage.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.05 REQUIRED PLOT PLAN INFORMATION.
   When application is made for a building permit, the applicant shall furnish
a plot plan drawn by a competent engineer or surveyor showing the natural grade
at all corners of the lot, any break in natural grade within lot lines and the
elevation of sufficient adjacent lots together with proposed finished grades of
the lot to be improved.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.06 DRAINAGE INSPECTION PERMIT FEES.
   See Section
1321.03 for provisions concerning grade and drainage inspection fees.
1337.07 PRIOR APPROVAL OF GRADING PLANS.
   No building permit shall be issued until plans for grade lines and drainage
for surface water from the entire lot have been submitted and approved in
writing on such plans by the City Engineer.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.08 APPROVAL UPON COMPLETION OF GRADING.
   No building, dwelling or other structure shall be occupied, offered for sale
by the owner, his agent or anyone having an interest therein, or otherwise used
or disposed of until the grading of the lot and provisions for drainage thereof
are in accordance with the plans approved by the City Engineer. After all work
has been completed, the City Engineer shall certify on such plans that the
grading and/or drainage of the lot has been completed according to the plans
and is approved by him.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.09 ENGINEER TO FIX ALL FINISHED GRADE LINES.
   The City Engineer shall be charged with the duty and final determination of
natural grade lines and shall establish or approve in writing the finished
grade lines for all streets, sidewalks, boulevards, sanitary and storm sewers,
dwellings, buildings and structures of every kind and description before any
such improvement is undertaken or made.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.10 ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT.
   The duty of administering and enforcing the provisions of this Chapter is
hereby conferred upon the Building Commissioner.
(Ord. 27-59. Passed 7-13-59.)
1337.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1339
Topsoil Stripping and Removal
1339.01   Permit required.
1339.02   Condition of issuance.
1339.03   Permit revocation.
1339.04   Bond or insurance required.
1339.05   Exception; waiver of bond or insurance.
1339.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Obstructing natural watercourses - see S.U. & P.S.
919.01
Drainage and grade establishment - see BLDG. Ch.
1337
 
 
1339.01 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   The removal or stripping of the top or surface soil from any real property
or portion thereof in the City is hereby prohibited, unless done pursuant to a
building permit for such property issued by the Building Commissioner, or
pursuant to a permit to remove or strip such soils which has been first issued
by the Safety-Service Director as herein provided.
(Ord. 1993. Passed 10-22-51.)
1339.02 CONDITIONS OF ISSUANCE.
   The Director of Public Safety-Service shall only issue a permit for the
removal or stripping of soil after careful consideration of the method of
removal or stripping to be used and a determination that such soil stripping or
removal and proposed method of doing so will not interfere with the lawful use
or enjoyment of surrounding property and will not depreciate the values of such
surrounding property. The permit shall set forth therein the method of removal
or stripping, the approximate quantity of soil to be removed or affected, the
time in which it must be done and such further terms and conditions as the
Director deems are necessary to preserve public peace, property, health and
safety., (Ord. 1993. Passed 10-22-51.)
1339.03 PERMIT REVOCATION.
   Any violation of the terms set forth by the Director of Public Safety-
Service under which the permit is granted shall be deemed sufficient grounds
upon which the Director is authorized to revoke such permit. (Ord. 1993. Passed
10-22-51.)
1339.04 BOND OR INSURANCE REQUIRED.
   Before such soil removal or stripping permit (other than a building permit)
is granted, the applicant shall deposit with the Director of Public Safety-
Service a bond or public liability insurance policy which will indemnify the
public and surrounding property owners against any damage which may be caused
by or in removing or stripping such top or surface soil. The form and the
amount thereof shall be first approved and determined by the Director before
acceptance. (Ord. 1993. Passed 10-22-51.)
1339.05 EXCEPTIONS; WAIVER OF BOND OR INSURANCE.
   Incidental removal or stripping of top or surface soil from any lot or
parcel of land or portion thereof in the City by the owner or lessee thereof,
not exceeding a total of three cubic yards, is hereby expressly excepted from
the provisions of this Chapter. Should the total removal or stripping at any
future time reach such maximum of three cubic yards, the provisions of this
chapter will apply to all future removals and stripping. If the quantity
thereafter to be removed or stripped is less than three cubic yards, the
Director of Public Safety Service may waive the bond and public liability
insurance provision and issue a permit, provided he first determines that such
additional soil removal will not violate the intent and spirit of this chapter
and that such proposed additional soil removal will not be detrimental to
public peace, health, property and safety.
1339.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provisions of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses. (Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1340
Smoke and Carbon Monoxide (CO) Detector Requirements for Leased or Rented
Properties
1340.01   Intent.
1340.02   Standards for the installation smoke detectors.
1340.03   Standards for the installation of carbon monoxide detectors.
1340.04   Standards for the maintenance and use of smoke and carbon monoxide
detectors.
1340.05   Tampering prohibited.
1340.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Ohio Building Code adopted – see BLDG. Ch
1301
Residential Code of Ohio adopted – see BLDG. Ch
1303
Property Maintenance Code adopted – see BLDG. Ch
1370
Ohio Fire Code adopted – see FIRE PREVENTION Ch
1501
 
 
1340.01 INTENT.
   The provisions of this code are intended to provide an early warning fire
and carbon monoxide detection for persons in leased or rental dwelling units.
(Ord. 25-08. Passed 2-25-08.)
1340.02 STANDARDS FOR THE INSTALLATION SMOKE DETECTORS.
   Single and multiple-station smoke detectors/alarms shall be installed and
maintained in accordance with the codes as adopted and the manufactures
instructions in the following locations:
   (a)   In each room used for sleeping purposes.
   (b)   Outside each separate sleeping area in the immediate vicinity of the
bedrooms.
   (c)   On each additional story of the dwelling/dwelling unit, including
basements but not including crawl spaces and uninhabitable attics. In dwellings
or dwelling units with split levels and without intervening door between the
adjacent levels, a smoke alarm installed on the upper level shall suffice for
the adjacent lower level provided that the lower level is less than one full
story below the upper level.
      (Ord. 25-08. Passed 2-25-08.)
      
1340.03 STANDARDS FOR THE INSTALLATION OF CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS.
   Carbon monoxide detectors/alarms shall be installed and maintained in
accordance with the codes adopted, Chapter 9 of the Ohio Building, Chapter 11
of the Ohio Fire Code and the manufactures instructions. The detector/alarms
shall meet and conform to UL 217, UL 2034, UL 2075 and NFPA 720 as applicable.
   (a)   Every dwelling unit shall be equipped with carbon monoxide detection/
alarms outside of separate sleeping areas in the immediate vicinity of the
bedrooms. Where a fuel-burning appliance is located within a bedroom or its
attached bathroom, carbon monoxide detection shall be installed within the
bedroom.
   (b)   The City of Rocky River reserves the right to make exceptions to the
standards for installation of carbon monoxide detectors/alarm in dwelling units
that:
      (1)   Do not rely on combustion of fossil fuel for heat, hot water or to
cook
      (2)   Is not connected in any way to an attached garage
      (3)   Is not sufficiently close to any source of carbon monoxide so as to
receive carbon monoxide from that source.
         (Ord. 72-21. Passed 11-8-21.)
1340.04 STANDARDS FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND USE OF SMOKE AND CARBON MONOXIDE
DETECTORS.
   (a)   It is the responsibility of the owner of a structure to supply and
install all required detectors/alarms. It is the responsibility of the tenant
to test and to provide general maintenance for the detectors/alarms within the
tenant's dwelling unit and to notify the owner or the authorized agent of the
owner in writing of any deficiencies that the tenant cannot correct. The owner
is responsible for providing one tenant per dwelling unit with written
information regarding detector/alarm testing and maintenance.
   (b)   The tenant is responsible for the replacement of any required
batteries in the detectors/alarms in the tenants dwelling unit, except that the
owner shall insure that the batteries are in operating condition at the time
the tenant takes possession of the dwelling unit. The tenant shall provide the
owner or the authorized agent of the owner with access to the dwelling unit to
correct any deficiencies in the detectors/alarms that have been reported in
writing to the owner or the authorized agent of the owner
   (c)   Combination smoke/carbon monoxide detector/alarms are allowed as long
as the unit emits an alarm that clearly differentiates between the smoke or
carbon monoxide hazard.
   (d)   The smoke and carbon monoxide detectors/alarms required may be either
battery powered, plug-in with battery back-up, or hard wired into the
structure's AC power line with secondary battery back-up in accordance with
building and fire codes.
(Ord. 72-21. Passed 11-8-21.)
1340.05 TAMPERING PROHIBITED.
   (a)   No person shall, without privilege to do so, knowingly move, deface,
damage, destroy or otherwise improperly tamper with a smoke or carbon monoxide
detector/alarm required to be installed pursuant to the provisions of this
chapter so as to destroy or diminish its effectiveness or availability for its
intended purpose.
   (b)   Any smoke detector/alarm which is missing a battery or has an
inoperable battery shall be replaced by the responsible party with a tamper-
proof smoke detector/alarm with a sealed battery. (Ord. 72-21. Passed 11-8-21.)
1340.99  PENALTY.
   (a)    Willful failure to install or maintain in operating condition any
smoke or carbon monoxide detector/alarm required by this code is guilty of a
minor misdemeanor for the first offense and for a second offense or subsequent
offense shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the forth degree. Each day's
violation shall constitute a separate and distinct offense.
   (b)    Tampering with, removing, destroying, disconnecting, disabling, or
removing the batteries from any installed smoke or carbon monoxide detector/
alarm, except in the course of inspection, maintenance, or replacement of the
detector/alarm is guilty of a minor misdemeanor for the first offense and for a
second offense or subsequent offense shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the
first degree.
(Ord. 25-08. Passed 2-25-08.)
CHAPTER 1341
Outside Unenclosed Stairways
1341.01   Building defined.
1341.02   Outside unenclosed stairways prohibited.
1341.03   Enforcement and administration.
1341.99   Penalty.
 
 
1341.01 BUILDING DEFINED.
   "Building", for the purpose of this Chapter, shall mean a building over one
(1) story in height wherein residence units to be used as such are provided for
or exist on the upper floor or floors.
(Ord. 2867. Passed 2-28-55.)
1341.02 OUTSIDE UNENCLOSED STAIRWAYS PROHIBITED.
   No person shall erect or construct any steps or stairway as a part of and on
the outside of a building in the City, which steps or stairway are used or
intended to be used as a means of entrance to and exit from the upper stories
of such building thereof, unless such steps or stairway are enclosed and not
exposed to the weather.
(Ord. 2867. Passed 2-28-55.)
1341.03 ENFORCEMENT AND ADMINISTRATION.
   The Building Commissioner is designated as the administering officer to
enforce the provisions of this Chapter.
(Ord. 2867. Passed 2-28-55.)
1341.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1343
Heating Occupied Buildings
1343.01   Definition; exceptions.
1343.02   Minimum temperature required.
1343.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCE
Unvented gas heaters - see GEN. OFF.
521.02
 
 
1343.01 DEFINITION; EXCEPTIONS.
   (a)   "At all such times when so occupied", as used in this Chapter, unless
otherwise provided by a contract or agreement, shall include twenty-four (24)
hours per day in a building or portion thereof occupied as a home or place of
residence, and during the usual working hours, established and maintained in a
building or portion thereof occupied as a business establishment, of each day
whenever the outer or street temperature shall fall below fifty (50) degrees
Fahrenheit.
   (b)   Nothing herein shall apply to buildings or portions thereof used and
occupied by trades, businesses or occupations where high or low temperatures
are essential and unavoidable.
(Ord. 1816. Passed 12-26-50.)
   (c)   This Chapter shall be modified to comply with any emergency building
temperature restrictions promulgated by the United States Department of Energy.
1343.02 MINIMUM TEMPERATURE REQUIRED.
   It shall be the duty of every person who shall have contracted or
undertaken, or shall be bound to heat or to furnish heat for any building or
portion thereof occupied as a home or place of residence of one (1) or more
persons, or as a business establishment where one (1) or more persons are
employed, to heat or to furnish heat for every occupied room in such building
or portion thereof, so that a minimum temperature of seventy (70) degrees
Fahrenheit may be maintained therein at all such times when so occupied.
   Whenever a building is heated by means of a furnace, boiler or other
apparatus under the control of the owner, agent or lessee of such building,
such owner, agent or lessee, in the absence of a written or verbal contract or
agreement to the contrary, shall be deemed to have contracted, undertaken or
bound himself to furnish heat in accordance with the provisions of this
Chapter.
(Ord. 1816. Passed 12-26-50.)
1343.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses. (Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1345
Garbage Disposals
1345.01   Mechanical disposal required; specifications.
1345.02   Plans required for building permit.
1345.03   Unit required for certificate of occupancy.
1345.04   Repair inspections; order to comply.
1345.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Garbage and rubbish collection - see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
941
Incinerator regulations - see BLDG. Ch.
1373
 
 
1345.01 MECHANICAL DISPOSAL REQUIRED; SPECIFICATIONS.
   No building designed or intended for a use, or to be used for a purpose
which results in the production of garbage, shall be erected in the City,
unless a mechanical garbage disposal unit is properly installed therein for
disposal of all garbage which may exist or accumulate on such premises during
its occupancy. Such mechanical garbage disposal unit shall comply with the
specifications now on file in the offices of the Building Division, which
specifications are hereby approved.
(Ord. 42-72. Passed 5-22-72.)
1345.02 PLANS REQUIRED FOR BUILDING PERMIT.
   No building permit shall be issued for the erection of any home, residential
apartment, hotel, motel or other building as set forth in Section
1345.01 unless the plans and specifications therefor show and provide for a
mechanical garbage disposal unit properly installed as set forth in Section
1345.01.
(Ord. 251-59. Passed 5-23-60.)
1345.03 UNIT REQUIRED FOR CERTIFICATE OF OCCUPANCY.
   No Certificate of Occupancy shall be issued by the Building Commissioner for
the occupation of any such home, residential apartment, hotel, motel or other
building as provided in Section
1345.01 until such garbage disposal unit is provided for and installed as set
forth in Section
1345.01.
(Ord. 251-59. Passed 5-23-60.)
1345.04 REPAIR INSPECTIONS; ORDER TO COMPLY.
   The Director of Public Safety-Service or the Building Commissioner, at his
direction, shall have the duty of inspecting such garbage disposal unit
including its installation, from time to time in the future. Should he find the
same in need of repair or replacement, he shall order the same to be done by
the owner, lessee or other person in charge of the premises. The order shall be
immediately complied with by such owner, lessee or other person in charge of
the premises.
(Ord. 251-59. Passed 5-23-60.)
1345.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1347
Swimming Pools
1347.01   Private residential swimming pool and public swimming pool defined.
1347.02   Compliance and location.
1347.03   Permit and fee.
1347.04   Lifeguard and safety equipment for swimming pools.
1347.05   Disinfection and quality of water.
1347.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Municipal swimming pool - see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
951
Private swimming pools - see DEV.
1153.15(h)
Artificial lighting devices - see BLDG. Ch.
1351
 
 
1347.01 PRIVATE RESIDENTIAL SWIMMING POOL AND PUBLIC SWIMMING POOL DEFINED.
   For the purpose of this Chapter:
   (a)   "Private residential swimming pool" means any swimming pool located at
a three (3) family or less dwelling which is for the exclusive use of the
residents and their non-paying guests.
   (b)   "Public swimming pool" means any indoor and outdoor structure, chamber
or tank containing a body of water for swimming, diving or bathing and operated
by any person as defined herein, whether he be owner, lessee, operator,
licensee, or concessionaire, regardless of whether a fee is charged for such
use.
   (c)   "Pool" as used herein refers to either of the foregoing definitions.
   The requirements of this Chapter are in addition to other requirements of
the Codified Ordinances; in case of conflict, this Chapter shall control.
(Ord. 49-87. Passed 6-22-87.)
1347.02 COMPLIANCE AND LOCATION.
   (a)   No outdoor swimming pool shall be constructed or installed unless the
requirements and conditions specified in Section
1153.15(h) of the Development Code are complied with.
   (b)   If the location of the proposed swimming pool and fence meets all
other lawful requirements but in the opinion of the Safety-Service Director
interferes with the ready access of the surrounding buildings in the event of
fire or other emergency, the permit shall be denied.
(Ord. 73-72. Passed 6-12-72.)
1347.03 PERMIT AND FEE.
   No outdoor swimming pool, including fence as required by this Chapter, shall
be constructed or installed unless a written permit to do so is first obtained
from the Building Division and approved by the Building Commissioner. A written
application shall be made for such permit, signed by the owner of the property
or the contractor engaged for such construction, and accompanied by a fee as
specified in Section
1321.01. Such application shall be accompanied by plans and specifications
therefor and by an accurate plan or sketch, drawn to scale, showing the exact
location of the proposed swimming pool and fence on the property.
(Ord. 73-73. Passed 6-12-72.)
1347.04 LIFEGUARD AND SAFETY EQUIPMENT FOR SWIMMING POOLS.
   (a)   Lifeguards shall be provided at every swimming pool of two thousand
(2,000) square feet of pool surface or greater during all periods it is open
for use. This requirement includes hotel, motel, apartment and condominium
pools. All pools that are not required to have a lifeguard shall have a sign
posted in a clearly discernable location in the pool area or room that reads
"Warning, No Lifeguard, Persons Age 16 Years and Younger Not Permitted to Swim
Without an Accompanying Adult". Any pool that has a diving board shall have a
lifeguard during all periods it is open for use, notwithstanding that its
surface area may be less than two thousand (2,000) square feet.
      (1)   Any lifeguard employed as required hereunder shall have a Red Cross
Senior Life Saving Certificate or its equivalent, as determined by the
Department of Public Safety-Service and shall be in constant attendance at such
pool.
      (2)   The foregoing requirements shall not apply to single-family or two
or three family dwellings.
   (b)   Each swimming pool shall provide at least one (1) unit of lifesaving
equipment for each two thousand (2,000) square feet of pool surface or fraction
thereof. One (1) unit of lifesaving equipment shall include:
      (1)   A Coast Guard approved ring buoy or equivalent buoyant throwing
device fitted with one-fourth (1/4) inch diameter line at least one and one-
half (1-1/2) times longer than the maximum width of the pool.
      (2)   A reach pole or shepherd's crook with blunted ends and a minimum
length of twelve (12) feet.
         (Ord. 48-87. Passed 6-22-87.)
1347.05 DISINFECTION AND QUALITY OF WATER.
   (a)   Swimming pools when in use shall be continuously disinfected by an
automatic chemical feeding device using a disinfectant which imparts an easily
measured residual effect. When chlorine is used, a free chlorine residual of at
least 0.4 ppm shall be maintained throughout the pool whenever it is open or in
use. If other chemicals are used, residuals of equivalent disinfecting strength
shall be maintained. A testing kit which is approved by the Director for
measuring the concentration of the disinfectant shall be provided at each
swimming pool.
   (b)   Swimming pool water shall be maintained in an alkaline condition as
indicated by a pH of not less than 7.2 and not over 8.0. A pH testing kit which
is approved by the Director shall be provided at each swimming pool.
   (c)   Swimming pool water shall have sufficient clarity when in use, so that
a black disc, six (6) inches in diameter, is readily visible when placed on a
light field at the deepest point of the swimming pool. There shall be no
indication of algae growth or sediment in the pool when in use.
   (d)   Bacteriological samples are not required to be routinely taken at a
swimming pool. However, when the Board of Health determines that
bacteriological samples are required for enforcement purposes, the following
standards are applicable: not more than fifteen percent (15%) of the samples of
not less than four (4) samples in a month shall:
      (1)   Contain more than two hundred (200) bacteria per milliliter as
determined by the standard (35 degrees c) agar plate count; or
      (2)   Show positive test (confirmed test) for coliform organisms in any
of the five (5) 10-milliliter portions of a sample or more than 3.0 coliform
organisms per one hundred (100) ml. when the membrane filter test is used.
   (e)   The foregoing requirements shall not apply to single-family or two or
three family dwellings.
(Ord. 47-87. Passed 6-22-87.)
1347.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provisions of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1349
Underground Shelters
1349.01   Emergency purpose only; accessory use.
1349.02   Permit required; Building Code to apply.
1349.03   Approval of plans; compliance with federal recommendations.
1349.04   Location restricted to zoning.
1349.05   Debris removal and ground surface restoration.
1349.06   Inspection; sanitary condition required.
1349.07   Use for emergency only.
1349.08   Right of revocation by Council.
1349.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Barricades and warning lights - see GEN. OFF.
521.03
Drainage and grade establishment - see BLDG. Ch.
1337
 
 
1349.01 EMERGENCY PURPOSE ONLY; ACCESSORY USE.
   (a)   The construction of underground shelters in private property in the
City is hereby authorized as a permitted use, such use being specifically
restricted, however, to the sole purpose of an emergency shelter, when and in
the event of a threatened or actual nuclear bomb attack, hurricane or other
like occurrence of force which endangers human life.
   (b)   Such underground shelter shall only be permitted as an accessory to an
existing home, apartment, store or other building on the premises in which it
is to be constructed.
(Ord. 186-57. Passed 9-23-57.)
1349.02 PERMIT REQUIRED; BUILDING CODE TO APPLY.
   (a)   Before constructing any underground shelter, a permit to do so must
first be obtained from the Building Commissioner. All construction work is to
be under his supervision and inspection.
   (b)   The provisions of the Building Code shall apply to such construction
insofar as the same are applicable thereto.
(Ord. 186-57. Passed 9-23-57.)
1349.03 APPROVAL OF PLANS; COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL RECOMMENDATIONS.
   No permit to construct an underground shelter shall be issued until the
Building Commissioner has approved the plans and specifications for such
structure and has determined that the same comply and conform in all respects
to one of the types of underground shelters recommended by the Federal
Department of Defense, Office of Civil and Defense Mobilization.
(Ord. 185-62. Passed 11-12-62.)
1349.04 LOCATION RESTRICTED TO ZONING.
   The location of an underground shelter on a lot or parcel of land shall be
restricted to that area on which, according to the provisions of the Zoning
Ordinance, a main or accessory building could be erected on such lot or parcel
of land.
(Ord. 186-57. Passed 9-23-57.)
1349.05 DEBRIS REMOVAL AND GROUND SURFACE RESTORATION.
   Upon completion of such underground shelter, the permittee shall remove all
building debris from the premises and restore the surface of the ground which
has been disturbed or altered to its original condition immediately prior to
the commencement of the construction, except as to any change of grade of the
land made necessary in completing such shelter, or the parts of such shelter
which extend above the ground surface.
(Ord. 186-57. Passed 9-23-57.)
1349.06 INSPECTION; SANITARY CONDITION REQUIRED.
   Any underground shelter, as provided for herein, shall at all reasonable
times be subject to the inspection and supervision of the Chiefs of the Police
and Fire Divisions, as well as the Building Commissioner, and shall always be
kept in a clean and sanitary condition.
(Ord. 186-57. Passed 9-23-57.)
1349.07 USE FOR EMERGENCY ONLY.
   No underground shelter shall be used for any purpose other than that of an
emergency shelter to protect life during a threatened or actual emergency of
the nature and kind as set forth in Section
1349.01, to wit: nuclear attack, hurricane or other like occurrence of force
which endangers human life. Such shelter shall at all times be kept in good
repair and the interior thereof free and clear of all articles of personal
property except such as are intended for use while occupied as an emergency
shelter.
(Ord. 186-57. Passed 9-23-57.)
1349.08 RIGHT OF REVOCATION BY COUNCIL.
   In granting permission to construct any underground shelter as herein
provided, the City Council expressly reserves the right to revoke, by future
legislation, such permission and order the removal of any and all of such
shelters should the protection which it affords be no longer needed, or should
other and more effective means of protection have been devised and are
available for public use.
(Ord. 186-57. Passed 9-23-57.)
1349.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1351
Artificial Lighting Devices
1351.01   Operation of lights.
1351.02   Use in residence or apartment districts.
1351.03   Height restrictions; installation and shielding.
1351.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Lighting hours for outdoor shows - see BUS. REG.
725.07
 
 
1351.01 OPERATION OF LIGHTS.
   All lighting operating after any upgrade, improvement or construction shall
comply with Rocky River Codified Ordinance
1181.13.
(Ord. 4-23. Passed 2-13-23.)
1351.02 USE IN RESIDENCE OR APARTMENT DISTRICTS.
   All artificial lighting of private premises or the outside of buildings
which are over fifteen (15) feet from the ground shall not be used or
maintained in a district zoned for single or two-family residence, group
dwellings or apartment use, from 10:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m. of any day, except,
subject to the candle requirements of Rocky River Codified Ordinance Section
1181.13(c)(1), when used during the entrance to or exit from the premises or
building on which such lights are situated by a person entering or leaving such
premises or building.
(Ord. 4-23. Passed 2-13-23.)
1351.03 HEIGHT RESTRICTIONS; INSTALLATION AND SHIELDING.
   Artificial lighting fixtures to be used in the night season shall not be
installed on the premises or on the outside of a building in districts zoned by
the City for single or two-family residence, group dwelling or apartment use,
at a height greater than fifteen (15) feet from the ground level, and shall be
shown on the plans and specifications submitted to the Building Commissioner
when an application for a building permit is made. All such lights shall be
installed at right angles to and facing the ground and shall be subject to the
candle requirements of Rocky River Codified Ordinance Section
1181.13(c)(1).
(Ord. 4-23. Passed 2-13-23.)
1351.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)

1353.01   Construction types.

   No building shall be erected or moved onto a site in a business district as
established in the Zoning Code unless the construction is Type 1, 2A, 2B, 3A,
or 3B as established by the Ohio Building Code. (Ord. 139-02. Passed 9-23-02.)

CHAPTER 1354
Wrecking and Razing Buildings
1354.01   Permit and fee required.
1354.02   Attendant.
1354.03   Time of completion.
1354.04   Insurance.
1354.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Removal of unsafe structures - see Ohio R.C. 715.26(B), 715.261
 
 
1354.01 PERMIT AND FEE REQUIRED.
   When any person desires to wreck or raze any structure or building within
the City, he shall apply to the Building Division for a permit for that purpose
and before the same is issued, shall pay a fee in accordance with the
provisions of Section
1321.05.
(Ord. 38-76. Passed 6-14-76.)
1354.02 ATTENDANT.
   The applicant shall file with the Director of Public Safety-Service the name
of an adult attendant whose sole duty shall be to protect and safeguard the
pedestrian and vehicular traffic and to prevent any person from entering the
premises. Such adult attendant shall be on duty on the premises on a twenty-
four (24) hour a day basis.
(Ord. 38-68. Passed 3-11-68.)
1354.03 TIME OF COMPLETION.
   Within seventy-two (72) hours after any exterior door or window is removed,
the entire structure or building must be completely razed, basement area filled
and the surface graded and cleared of all building material and debris. All
utilities and sewers are to be shut off and/or plugged at the street line.
(Ord. 160-66. Passed 11-28-66.)
1354.04 INSURANCE.
   Before such wrecking or razing permit is granted, the applicant shall
deposit with the City, evidence of liability insurance policy which will serve
as security to the City for any damages suffered by the City, including any
damage caused to sidewalks or other public property, caused by such wrecking or
razing. The form and the amount thereof shall be first approved and determined
by the Director of Public Safety-Service.
(Ord. 160-66. Passed 11-28-66.)
   
1354.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses. (Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1355
Moving Buildings
1355.01   Permit and fee required.
1355.02   Permit approval; police escort and conditions.
1355.03   Insurance required for traversing public ground.
1355.04   Permit limitations.
1355.05   Basement; sewers and utilities.
1355.06   Deposit.
1355.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to license house movers - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
Permit and fee for commercial and heavy vehicles - see TRAF.
339.02
Barricades and warning lights - see GEN. OFF.
521.03
Moving buildings into fire limits - see BLDG.
1353.01
 
 
1355.01 PERMIT AND FEE REQUIRED.
   When any person desires to move any structure or building across any
sidewalk, street, highway or public place within the City limits, he shall
apply to the Building Division for a permit for that purpose, and, before the
same is issued, shall pay a fee in accordance with Section
1321.05. There shall be no fee for moving a structure from one location to
another when no public ground is traversed.
(Ord. 38-76. Passed 6-14-76.)
1355.02 PERMIT APPROVAL; POLICE ESCORT AND CONDITIONS.
   Before any permit for moving any structure or building is issued, it shall
be approved by the Director of Public Safety-Service.
   Whenever it is deemed necessary in the public interest, the Director may
require that such moving operations be conducted under the supervision of off-
duty policemen as shall reasonably be required to safeguard life and property
during the course of moving operations. The charge therefor shall be negotiated
between them and the mover, and shall be deducted from the deposit required
under Section
1321.05. The Director may prescribe in writing, reasonable conditions,
requirements, routes and precautions, and the days and hours of the day during
which such moving operations shall be conducted, as deemed necessary in the
public interest. All moving operations shall be performed in conformity
therewith.
(Ord. 38-76. Passed 6-14-76.)
1355.03 INSURANCE REQUIRED FOR TRAVERSING PUBLIC GROUND.
   Before any permit for moving any structure or building across any sidewalk,
street, highway or public place within the City limits shall be issued, the
applicant or his agent shall furnish an insurance policy, in an amount of One
Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000) for injury or death to one (1) person,
Three Hundred Thousand Dollars ($300,000) for injury or death to more than one
(1) person and Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000) property damage. The insurance
policy shall provide that the City be named as insured and further that the
applicant and his insurer shall hold the City harmless against any liabilities,
judgments, damages, costs and expenses which may in any wise accrue or arise
against the City in consequence of the granting of such a permit or the
performance of any work pursuant thereto.
(Ord. 185-62. Passed 11-12-62.)
                                                            
1355.04 PERMIT LIMITATIONS.
   The following limitations shall apply on the use of a building moving
permit:
   (a)   The granting of a permit does not guarantee that the load described
can be moved without damage to the pavement or structures although the permit
is granted on the assumption that the load can be moved without damage, based
on the best information available. The permittee shall be held liable for any
damage caused by the movement. The Municipality assumes no responsibility for
damage to the permittee's equipment or load being moved due to any such
failure. The permittee agrees to hold the Municipality harmless from all
claims, damages or proceedings of any kind, and from all responsibility for
personal or property damages (public or private) caused directly or indirectly
as a result of the transportation of such vehicles or objects.
   (b)   The permit shall be in the possession of the driver at all times
during the progress of transportation and will be shown on demand to any police
officer or City official.
   (c)   The permission granted restricts the movement of the vehicles or
objects to the streets specified between the points designated and within the
time allotted.
   (d)   No vehicle or building shall be left parked on the roadway either day
or night, except in case of an emergency, in which case adequate protection
shall be provided for the traveling public.
   (e)   The operator of the vehicle must comply with all laws, rules or
regulations covering the movement of traffic over streets and with reductions
of legal weight posted on roadways or bridges.
   (f)   A permit is void at any time when road, weather or traffic conditions
make travel unsafe.
   (g)   A permit will not be issued for built-up loads that are divisible into
legal loads.
   (h)   Oversize or overweight loads shall be operated or moved at such speeds
and in such a manner as to cause a minimum of interference with other traffic
and minimum impact stresses on structures and pavements.
   (i)   Loads having extremely large dimensions shall require additional
protective measures when necessary for the safeguarding of other traffic. Due
regard shall be taken of traffic in both directions, and every possible effort
shall be made to prevent traffic congestion. Red flags, one (1) or more flagmen
or a pilot car may be required.
   (j)   Noncompliance with the general or special provisions of a permit,
exceeding the weights or dimensions granted, or operating on dates or upon
streets other than assigned, shall render the permit null and void and the
operator of the vehicle subject to arrest.
      (Ord. 185-62. Passed 11-12-62.)
1355.05 BASEMENT; SEWERS AND UTILITIES.
   Within seventy-two (72) hours after any part of the structure or building
has been removed from its foundation, the basement area shall be filled and the
surface graded and cleared of all building material and debris.
   Also, within such seventy-two (72) hour period, all utilities and sewers are
to be shut off and/or plugged. Such utilities and sewers shall be plugged
either at the inspection test tee, curb line or the building foundation line at
the discretion of the Director of Public Safety-Service.
(Ord. 16-67. Passed 2-27-67.)
1355.06 DEPOSIT.
   At the time of the application for a moving permit, the applicant shall make
a deposit with the Building Division as provided by Section
1321.05. Any and all charges due the City for the moving of the structure or
building shall be deducted from the deposit.
(Ord. 38-76. Passed 6-14-76.)
1355.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor for the first offense. Whoever violates any provision of this
Chapter shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor for the second offense
or subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 7-82. Passed 2-8-82.)
CHAPTER 1370

1301

1303

1337
